decks.notes: This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber, while using cards like Amulet of Vigor to untap lands for explosive plays. The goal is to get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield to search for powerful lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and The Mycosynth Gardens, allowing for massive damage and board control. The deck's key strategy revolves around utilizing the synergy between lands, creatures, and spells to quickly assemble a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to apply early pressure with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Tarmogoyf, while also using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to eliminate blockers or finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Underworld Breach and Mishra's Bauble for card advantage and additional reach. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient threats while keeping up the pressure.

This deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures quickly and efficiently, supporting them with powerful spells like Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding helps to control the board while maximizing the deck's potential. The deck has a strong mana base with fetchlands and dual lands to provide consistent color fixing. The use of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility and utility to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient aggression and strong synergy between its cards.

This deck focuses on using cards like Architects of Will, Ardent Plea, and Shardless Agent to manipulate cards in the graveyard and bring out powerful creatures like Grief and Striped Riverwinder. By cycling through the deck with cards like Street Wraith and curating the graveyard, the goal is to eventually cast Living End to bring back all the powerful creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent in one big combo. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Faerie Macabre to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect the combo.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of removal spells, discard spells, and land destruction. The deck aims to control the battlefield and out-value the opponent by leveraging powerful board wipes like Damnation and Sheoldred's Edict. The inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and win conditions. The deck also utilizes strong finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm to close out games once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The main idea behind this Modern Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Smallpox and Mishra's Factory, while applying pressure with cards like The Rack. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Castle Locthwain to generate card advantage and ensure consistent mana production.
